triceps.title: 1. Close-Grip Bench Press
triceps.body: This exercise not only  work on the targeted area, but it will also improve upon your chest and core.
triceps.steps:
Steps :
1. Firstly grab a barbell with an overhand grip,then keeping your index fingers on the inside edge of the knurling (i.e. the rough and textural part of the bar)
2. Slightly arch your back to create or maintain minor space between your lower back and the bench.
3. Now life the bar off the rack and hold it above your sternum, keeping your arms completely straight with your elbows tucked at 45-degree angles on either side.
4. Finally lower the bar until it slightly touches your body, pause, and then drive through at your feet as you press the bar upward.
'During the last set, consider reducing the weight and then increasing the number of reps, pushing yourself to failure.
Sets: 3-4
Reps: 6-8
Rest: 60 seconds between each s'

triceps.title: 2. Cable Rope Tricep Pushdown
triceps.body: If you’re focusing the triceps, don’t overdo it on the weights when performing this exercise.
triceps.steps:
Steps :
1. Firstly attach a rope to the cable station’s high pulley.
2. Now grab the handle with an overhand grip along with keeping your arms bent and your hands shoulder-width apart.
3. Tuck your upper arms toward your sides.
4. By keeping your upper arms fixed in place, push the bar down until your elbows are locked.
5. Finally return to the starting position and repeat.
Sets: 3
Reps: 10
Rest: 60 seconds between each set

triceps.title: 3. Lying Triceps Extension
triceps.body:
This exercise is also known as the Skullcrusher and that importantly it’s not for beginners. There is more than one way to perform it like over-the-head vs behind-the-head, for instance, elbow extension remains constant.
After becoming master's of other tricep workouts and exercises, then only bring this one into the fold. When becoming a true master of your upper domain, perform this tricep exercise and a dumbbell chest press as a superset.
triceps.steps:
Steps :
1. Firstly grabbing the inner grip, press an EZ bar over your chest in the overhand grip position.
2. Now extend your arms straight up.
3. By keeping your elbows tucked in and your arms perpendicular to the floor, gradually lower the bar until it’s just above your forehead by about an inch.
4. Slowly bring your arms back to the starting position without locking yourelbows.
Repeat.
Sets: 3
Reps: 10-12
Rest: 60 seconds between each set

triceps.title: 4. Tricep Dips
triceps.body: Now starts with another tricep exercise for men who have more experience under their respective belts. It involves using you entire body weight and should be avoided by those with weak shoulders. At beginning start with  just 2 sets of 8-10 reps and increase the number of sets and reps as you improve over time.
triceps.steps:
Steps:
1. Firstly prop yourself up on the parallel bars, keeping your torso perpendicular to the floor.
2. Then maintaining the original position throughout along with bend your knees and cross your ankles.
3. Keep lower your body until your shoulder joints are below your elbows or just before you reach that position.
5. Finally push back up to the starting position, until your elbows are just short of locked.
Repeat.
Sets: 2
Reps: 8-10
Rest: 60 seconds between each set

triceps.title: 5. Bench Dip
triceps.body: This basic workout doesn’t require large amounts of muscle or experience. Just by grabbing a standard workout bench.
triceps.steps:
Steps :
1. Firstly stand up and face away from the bench, grabbing it with both hands at shoulder-width.
2. Then keeping your legs straight and extended in front of you, slowly lower down your body until your arms and forearms are at 90-degree angles.
3. Push through at the triceps as you lift back to the starting position.
Repeat.
Sets: 3
Reps: 10-12
Rest: 60 seconds between each set

triceps.title: 6. One-Arm Overhead Extension
triceps.body: Hey, buddies, you’re already doing something like this, making it a very simple and approachable tricep exercise.
triceps.steps:
Steps :
1. Firstly sit perfectly upright on a workout bench and grab a dumbbell with one hand.
2. Now holding the dumbbell by lifting your arm slightly behind your head with your elbow bent.
3. Extend your elbow until your arm is straight overhead.
4. Could perform 10 reps with one arm before switching to the other to round out the set.
Sets: 3
Reps: 10-12
Rest: 60 seconds between each set
